intro: Bondtia leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf bondtia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are broad and often have a waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is typically grown as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses due to its striking appearance.
